channel.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
channel.description:
![CrystalDawn|583x251](upload://3dlnZggz9W4UkG6dNT89l5WKhvM.jpg)
<big> Featured Auxy Artist #28: @crystldawnmusic </big>
<big>C</big>rystlDawn is an American artist who digs Electronic Chill & Chill Trap and plays piano. He released his **Moments** EP in 2017 and the **Nebula** Album in 2018. And a couple of days ago, he dropped a brand new track, named [Mist](https://soundcloud.com/crystldawn/mist). Check it out.
C.D. wrote an awesome Dream House Track for the Auxy House Challenge, with his chilled-out, dreamy track [Breeze](https://soundcloud.com/crystldawn/breeze). And later ran a remix competition for the track, which @Aviomusic won.
Here's some feedback about his music, from Soundcloud: >"Love this" "Super chill!" "pretty melodies" "I could listen to this all day!" "really nice change of drums..." "great production m8" "that lead sound is so good <3" "this is sweet" etc.
CrystlDawn enjoys listening to [Adam Hinden](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC58LkpfJG6-7lTaUqLUAQHA), [ODESZA](https://www.youtube.com/user/odeszamusic), [Petit Biscuit](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFuxVFn94f6Neyix7KPzyTg) & [Mount Dreams](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DElm7XKyzrA&list=PLK4xdnP9ImJg7JaKtotz7alBDmMsbV8OO&index=1). And provides feedback for plenty of forum member's music. So let's listen to his music and leave feedback.
:crystldawn: :crystldawn: :crystldawn:
**Week starting: 9 Jul 2018, 2018.** - Please listen to at least one of his tracks (or more) - Provide at least one Soundcloud comment / feedback about his music during the week. - Comment in this thread once you've provided any feedback. - If you want to be featured, remember to comment for others!
**Tracks**: :soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/crystldawn/tracks
**Albums**: :soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/crystldawn/albums
**Spotify:** :spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Me4uBIUisy1LhGS6DqzbP
**Apple Music:** :apple: https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/crystldawn/1297953124
**Deezer:** https://www.deezer.com/us/artist/13346213
**Amazon Music:** [Yep, it's here](https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=ntt_srch_drd_B076HR669T?ie=UTF8&field-keywords=crystldawn&index=digital-music&search-type=ss)
If you want to be in the weekly draw [add your name.](https://disco.auxy.co/t/forum-member-of-the-week-who-wants-to-be-involved/5518)

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
congrats @crystldawnmusic!! have always been a fan of your music!

palms: really awesome use of the rac pack! the drums are probably my favorite part, and the Allen/melodic perc/owl is so catchy as it stays constant in the background. literally can’t think of anything that can be fixed.

lost: melody gets me every time, so perfect. the pitch bend gives it such a great touch and paired with the classic melodic perc just makes it absolutely amazing. when the piano comes in it just gets even betterrrrr. only suggestion: would be sweet if you added another snare that is basically whack at a higher pitch with shortened length to play as a chill trap sort of snare.

winter: so eerie and chill i love it. i think you could up the lowpass on the drums a bit though and maybe add some snare rolls.

adventure: title fits so well! the use of otszil-style samples is also very nice. (fun fact: this song was stuck in my head for at least two days after it’s release.)

breeze: absolutely nailed the June on this one. snd the drums. and the melodic perc. and the atmosphere. you’re legit so much better than me lol

also really enjoyed listening to mist and surf, the percussion was brilliant in both of them!

please continue to make music, i can not survive without these chill vibes lol

@MisterMaster ty for giving me an excuse to binge listen some crystldawn

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: Stigmo
item.description:
@crystldawnmusic
I listened to a bunch of your tracks, and you have very nice style going there; a combination of chill and tropical vibes, which is great. Normally I’m not really into this chill genre, and I wouldn’t listen to it myself, but your stuff is quality nonetheless. I have to admit that I really like the tracks in which you instill emotion, such as Mist and Flow. Mist is just awesome. It’s pretty different from your other stuff. The intro is really good, and that part between 1:30 and 2:15, damn, that really got to me for some reason, which is good . Flow also has that emotional feel for me, so good job on that as well. What I also noticed while listening to your tracks is the use of percussion, it’s really solid man. I could learn a thing or two from that lol.
Keep it up man! You’re already at a high production level

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: Graye
item.description:
Your melodies are all perfect.
I really want to know how to make melodies like this.
So good job😄

I like how you use so many different instruments that go together, it really helps to hold my attention.

I especially like the guitar melody in surf that comes in at the beginning.

Your chords remind me of decruz, they sound more simple but there catch and convey a lot of emotion.

You definitely need vocals in your songs

You can get the vocals of a popular song for free on YouTube. And publish it as a remix.

Overall I really enjoy your music, and it’s really calming, and relaxing.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
Thanks to everyone in the community for the support!
I heard from various people that my chill style wasn’t really their thing, and I’m fine with that. I’ll continue broadening horizons and working in more genres, and will hope to appeal to more listeners.
Love you guys

Read full topic

item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Here’s some feedback for you cRyStaLdAwN.

Overall:

  • You’ve obviously found your niche, with chill. Enjoyed listening to it.
  • Understated drum layering, but always varied, interesting and on point.
  • Strong melodies and well-composed layers.
  • Dreamy instruments for the calming feels.
  • High production quality.

Mist - Great hook.

Surf - Smooth drums and guitar.

Breeze - Slow and controlled, with a strong melody. Went to click like, but already had. Obviously, I’ve got good taste.

Adventure - Love the bass at the start of the last section.

Looking back & Gaze - Unique drumming. You keep switching it up.

Winter - Another slow and controlled track. Like the way it drops back to pads and subtle sounds, then swells.

Citilights - Different to all of the above. Nice drum-rolls.

Lost - eerie lead and liked the arps.

Ocean - argh, wubs!!! This was 8-mths ago. Good individual parts, but not as cohesive as the tracks since.

Based on the tracks I listened to, there seems to be a difference in production quality between the tracks you wrote 8-mths ago and since. The new tracks sound richer and more dynamic. Did you change something, like your post-processing outside of Auxy?

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
I do it out of habit.

If I slam two words together that aren’t usually a single word, I sometimes use capitals to differentiate the words and make it easier to read.

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
Thanks!

I’ve got a question for the community - what’s behind the capitalization? I usually just use lowercase letters when typing my name, but some people capitalize the C and D. Not a problem with me, just curious.

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Totally random. I use the google random number generator.

The only exceptions are that my own name came up once and I chose not to do it. And a few people were randomly selected but not featured as they haven’t provided feedback on other featured members (in which case I marked their names with “skipped” so they would know).

So it’s a surprise for me who’s selected each week. Was glad to see you being chosen CrystlDawn.

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 28 - crystldawn
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
It is. As long as you give feedback regularly, you have a typical chance of becoming FMOTW. I wasn’t expecting to be it for a while (plenty of other people give more consistent feedback) but I ended up being it anyway, so it looks like it’s pretty random.

Read full topic
